alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 04 at 5:39AM ChST until April 07 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CHST FRIDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet expected in the surf zone tonight increasing to 10 to 12 feet Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...North and west facing reefs of Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM ChST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from this evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large north swell will enter the area and generate hazardous surf on north and west facing reefs tonight through Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
